bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 2, 1923

div1.p: Rose sends Carter a letter from Long concerning yellow fever at Ceara, Brazil.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, February 2, 1923
div1.opener:
I. H. B
Brazil.
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
WICKLIFFE ROSE
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
F. F. RUSSELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR OF
PUBLIC HEALTH LABORATORIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
HERMANN M. RIGGS
WALLACE BUTTRICK
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
FREDERICK T. GATES
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM M. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
February 2, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed copy of a
communication we have just received from
Assistant Surgeon General J. D. Long with
reference to yellow fever in Ceara.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor H. R. Carter
Assistant Surgeon General U.S.P.H.S.
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
WRR:EP E1
